title.narrative: OUTPUT 1.3: EQUITABLE ACCESS TO ESSENTIAL SERVICE PACKAGE

description.narrative: Output 1.3: Children and women have improved access to an essential service package and knowledge about appropriate healthy life practices, with a focus on the most vulnerable,including in emergencies., which contributes to Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change, Cross-Sectoral - Social And Behaviour Change (Covid), Fast-Track The End Of Hiv/Aids, Health And Development In Early Childhood And Adolescence, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care, Immunization Services As Part Of Primary Health Care (Covid), Mental Health And Psychosocial Well-Being, Nutrition Of Adolescents And Women, Research, Strengthening Primary Health Care And High-Impact Health Interventions. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Community Engagement, Social And Behaviour Change, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 1 - Health: By 2026, all children, adolescents and women have equitable access to and use quality, high-impact health services and adopt appropriate healthy life practices.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 1.3: Children and women have improved access to an essential service package and knowledge about appropriate healthy lifepractices, with a focus on the most vulnerable,including in emergencies.
